intro: Quinchamalium brevistaminatum, commonly known as the short-stamen quinchamalium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with small, hairy leaves and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically pale in color, with short stamens that give it its scientific name. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
